text: It was designed—and redesigned—for comfort. Destined for the director’s boardroom in the Merchants National Bank, the chair’s original design was critiqued by Purcell in a June 1913 note to his partner Elmslie: “GG, you have to do a little thinking on the chairs—they are not comfortable and must be made so.” One solution was to add a cushioned backrest that was as wide as possible.
title: Armchair
